content: knit once steek twice pattern by cassie breeding create a set of 2 4 6 coasters by knitting in the round using steek panels between each colorwork coaster after binding off secure the steek panels with a running back stitch cut along the center steek stitch and block the coasters voila a set of coasters abbreviations bor beginning of round co cast on bobble- bind off pm place marker mc main color cc-contrasting color knit once steek twice pattern by cassie breeding techniques  knitting in the round  steek panel  stranded colorwork  running backstitch  charted materials  worsted weight yarn sample knit using kelbourne woolens germantown mc 2 coasters - 20g 4 coasters - 40g 6 coasters 60g cc 2 coasters - 10g 4 coasters - 20g 6 coasters 30g  us size 7 circular needles recommended length 9in for 2 coasters 16in for 4 coasters 24in for 6 coasters or length necessary for magic loop as recommended per yarn band  tapestry needle  stitch markers 2 stitch markers for each coaster 1 of the markers should be a bor marker  sharp scissors gauge 21 stiches * 24 row per 4 inches note coasters at this gauge will measure approximately 4in x 4in a tighter gauge or thinner yarn will result in a smaller coaster and a looser gauge or thicker yarn will result in a larger coaster instructions 1 co 50 100 150 for 2 4 or 6 coasters with mc 2 join in the round place bor using mc knit one row place markers as follows repeat for each coaster k7 pm k18 pm* *last coaster will not need this marker as you will be back at bor 3 begin row 1 of chart adding in cc at bor continue knitting the chart through row 25 4 after completing chart knit 1 row in mc 5 bobble in mc weave in any ends abbreviations bor beginning of round co cast on bobble- bind off pm place marker mc main color cc-contrasting color knit once steek twice pattern by cassie breeding 6 using cc and a tapestry needle use a running backstitch on both column 2 and 6 of each steek panel to secure each coaster weave in ends running backstitch secure yarn on co edge from the wrong side bring yarn through two stitches above co edge and then bring yarn back through one stitch below repeat bringing yarn through two stitches from wrong side and back through one stitch until reaching the opposite edge secure yarn 7 after each steek panel is secure cut along column 4 of the steek panel to separate each coaster wet block pinning coasters flat to dry chart 25 25 24 24 23 23 22 22 21 21 20 20 19 19 18 18 17 17 16 16 15 15 14 14 13 13 12 12 11 11 10 10 9 9 8 8 7 7 6 6 5 5 4 4 3 3 2 2
